entry.title: How to install RethinkDB on Linux Mint 15 (Olivia)
entry.content:
I tried to follow the instructions on their website for pre-packaged binary but it did not work.

The instructions were for mint 16 and 17.

1
2
3
def cool
  puts "I'm cool"
end

Then i tried to install from source following their instructions and that did not work either.

The problem was apt-get could not find the required dependencies.

So then I decided to try and download source tar ball and proceed with ./configure, make, sudo make install.

I was hoping mint 15 would have enough tools/libs to get the job done.

I worked, everything seems to be running fine. I know it’s not a very smart way to proceed, but I decieded I could always abort the process if something went, wrong.:

The make took a super long time, in fact, I was starting to think it was hung but I left it alone and it finnished.
